page.title: 13Inversnaid Primary School
page.content: Inversnaid Primary School is a small one-teacher school. It takes children from Glengyle on the North shore of Loch Katrine and Couligart on the South shore of Loch Katrine to Inversnaid. The present building dates back to 1880. The roll has been as high as 30 and as low as 2 and is presently 11 from P1 to P7. The teacher lives in the school-house attached to the school. All children travel to school by mini-bus and attend from 9.00 to 3.30. The children stay in school for lunch,which is cooked on the premises. Accomodation consists of a classroom, G.P/dining room and kitchen. There are visiting teachers for needlecraft,P.E. and recorder. In the summer term the children attend swimming lessons in Callander.
